title: Ticket #5043: Schedd constraint for condor_q -global
description:
As CMS goes over 30 schedds on our pool, condor_q -g is becoming increasingly frustrating to work with. Typically, I'm looking for workflows that are running on a known subset of machines ("production" versus "analysis" versus "validation").

For management purposes, we already add custom attributes to the schedd's class ads. This allows us to do queries like: 

condor_status -schedd -const 'CMSGWMS_Type=?="prodschedd"'

Is it possible to do the same for querying schedds? I'm not sure what the CLI option should be, but I'm envisioning something like: 

condor_q -schedd-const 'CMSGWMS_Type=?="prodschedd"' -const 'RequestName=?="foo"'
remarks:
2015-Jul-08 19:56:37 by bbockelm:
Ping - can I get a quick code review on this one?

2015-Jul-09 12:46:35 by johnkn:
pretty sure this isn't the right error message: 

    fprint(stderr, "Error: Argument -schedd-constraint requires a filename\n");

I don't see any reason why -schedd-constraint shouldn't imply -global. For that matter maybe it should be called -global-constraint?. That is, I don't see any problem with specifying both -global and -schedd-constraint, to my mind it's a constraint on the global query, and thus not mutually exclusive to -global.

2015-Oct-01 15:31:09 by johnkn:
The code from [44881] was included in [45912] but modified so that -global and -schedd-constraint are not considered mutually exclusive.
